title.narrative: 2.2 SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND YOUTH EMPLOYMENT

description.narrative: Relevant national platforms and institutions have increased knowledge and capacity to provide skills, assets and competencies to adolescent girls and boys to increase their resilience and equip them for productive adulthood, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid), Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, adolescent girls and boys especially the most vulnerable have benefited from an improved skill-driven formal and non- formal education system, increased opportunity for civic engagement and participation, and strengthened protective environment from all forms of violence, exploitation and abuse for a smooth transition to adulthood

participating-org.narrative: THE INSTITUTE OF EDUCATION OF THE REPUBLIC OF AZERBAIJAN

related-activity.ref: 0310/A0/06/882 2. INVESTING IN THE SECOND DECADE OF LIFE AND THE TRANSITION TO ADULTHOOD

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Relevant national platforms and institutions have increased knowledge and capacity to provide skills, assets and competencies toadolescent girls and boys to increase their resilience and equip them for productive adulthood

description.narrative: Relevant national platforms and institutions, including youth development and formal education platforms, strengthened their capacities to provide 21st century skills and competencies to adolescent girls and boys, including young people with disabilities, increasing their skills for employment and life and resilience to emergencies. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/01/2022
